Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in rejecting Ms. Karathanos' application based on her qualifications as an archivist
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's work experience, lack of master's degree
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate error in decision
Legal_Rule: 'Usually required' means not always required in 'occupational factor' category, but treated as 'always required' in 'education and training' category
Procedural_Issue: Misinterpretation of regulatory language and failure to consider relevant factors
Grounds_for_Claim: Erroneous interpretation of 'usually required', inadequate assessment of experience
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision quashed, case remanded for reconsideration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to properly assess all relevant factors constitutes procedural unfairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Ms. Karathanos' work experience, educational background
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to visa officer's interpretation and assessment
Legal_Provision: Immigration Regulations - Occupational and educational requirements
Authority: Immigration officer, subject to judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of required educational qualification (master's degree)
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application under skilled worker or similar category
Governing_Rule: Interpretation of 'usually required' in immigration regulations
